features.name: pd_l1_expression_level_1
features.description: Quantification of PD-L1 expression in tumor tissue, measured as a percentage of positive tumor cells.
features.input_prompt: What is the PD-L1 expression level in the tumor tissue?
features.reference: High PD-L1 levels are associated with better response to immunotherapy.

features.name: tumor_mutational_burden_2
features.description: The total number of mutations per megabase of the tumor genome, indicating the mutational load.
features.input_prompt: What is the tumor mutational burden?
features.reference: Higher mutational burden may correlate with better outcomes in immunotherapy.

features.name: circular_rna_expression_3
features.description: Measurement of specific circular RNA levels that may be associated with non-small cell lung cancer progression.
features.input_prompt: What is the expression level of the specific circular RNA?
features.reference: Certain circular RNAs are implicated in tumorigenesis and cancer progression.

features.name: exosomal_protein_markers_4
features.description: Identification of specific protein markers found in exosomes derived from lung cancer cells, which may serve as non-invasive biomarkers.
features.input_prompt: What exosomal protein markers have been identified?
features.reference: Exosomal markers can provide insight into tumor dynamics and treatment response.

features.name: microrna_profile_5
features.description: Assessment of specific microRNA levels associated with non-small cell lung cancer, indicating potential diagnostic or prognostic value.
features.input_prompt: What is the microRNA profile observed in the tumor?
features.reference: MicroRNA profiles may correlate with disease progression and response to therapy.
